answers.answer: Your whole life is gonna change! You can espect that. At night itll get hard for you to sleep comfortabley. My friend got one of those O shaped pillows and put her belly in it at night and it'd be much more comfy for her. You may get sick a lot. If you do, eat some crackers right before you get out of bed and it should calm it down a bit. If you have some bleeding, dont hesitate to get it checked out. If you have horrible pain, dont wait to go in! Youre probably going to be gassy! It may be embarassing. You'll be peeing more most likely. Gosh theres so much stuff...i cant even think of it all at the moment. Im sure whatever I dont cover a bunch of ladies will on here
thanx you guys. its much appreciated.

Expect that there will be a lot of unusual changes to your body.  Sometimes it seems like every time you turn around its something new.  It usually starts with tender breasts, all day sickness, and constant peeing.  You will also be more tired than usual.  After the first trimester is over, you will usually have a break and have a period of feeling great.  You will start showing, feel baby kick, and people will start to notice you are pregnant.  Its possible to develop pregnancy related diabetes, or migraines.  Also yeast infections are more common during pregnancy.  They will test your blood sugar in the second trimester and if you start having abnormal headaches, vision changes etc. don't hesititate to call your doctor.  It seems like almost every woman bleeds some time in pregnancy.  Call your doctor, but don't automatically fear the worst.  Its usually just fine.  As you get bigger you will start feeling really uncomfortable.  You will need to sleep on your side and a body pillow is great help.  You might even need to sleep on the couch.  As you hit your third trimester and get really big, usually you will experiance some swelling in your ankles that can be painful, just remember to rest and elevate your feet frequently.  Don't be freaked out if you swell vaginally too.  Its just one of the areas below the baby so it gets increased blood flow as well.  Most of all you can expect for it to be a fun and worrisome 40 weeks, but no matter how many times you feel like total **** and say "what did I do", when you have that baby you will forget it all, even labor!  Congratulations and good luck.  Make sure you make plenty of time for celebrating your pregnancy!
Congrats! I think everyone covered everything but congrats on your pregnancy I hope the next 9 months go great for you! :)

question: Im going to be a first time mommy,any one have any tips on what to expect??
title: First time..
